intro: Dorstenia angusticornis, commonly known as the narrow-horned dodder, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble tendrils. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found growing on other plants, exhibiting a hemiparasitic lifestyle. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
